alert.note: Alert for Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:50PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Stillwater and southwestern Yellowstone Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 447 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm northwest of Laurel, or 14 miles southwest of Billings, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rain and possibly pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water on roads including I-90 between Laurel and Billings. Locations impacted include... Billings westside and Laurel. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
